summary: Discretionary funding for the Child Care and Development Fund—a significant source of federal funding for child care subsidies—was approximately doubled in 2018 to $5.2 billion. States must use some of the money they get to improve the quality of their child care services. In fiscal year 2017, a majority of states put their funds toward major state activities such as consumer education and establishing health...
title: Child Care: States Report Child Care and Development Funds Benefit All Children in Care
